reviews.title: Commendation.
reviews.review_text: Im attempted to find customer service but, alas, COULD NOT. So I will put my commendation here %26 just hope that somehow it gets to the right department. On my last order dated June 8, I was informed that I would NOT receive the following items from my order due to cancellation. I didn't understand. Just assumed you were OUT OF STOCK of the items and also any substitutions. The items were listed as: Zucchini, bananas, avocadoes, onions, chicken breast, and portabella mushrooms. I am very happy to report that every single item was delivered. And the man doing the delivering had even checked my dozen eggs and reported that one was broken. That was a first for us and very kind and unexpected as I once had 8 out of 18 eggs broken and it was NOT reported to us nor compensated.

reviews.title: My experience on deliveries
reviews.review_text: Also on time , wonderful delivery people. They are always pleasant and so helpful and respectful Items are what you ordered and once in a while there's a cracked egg or two or three , but to be expected. But Walmart is always good to refund you . So there's no stress over broken eggs . Thank you Walmart

reviews.title: Store pickup.
reviews.review_text: Kay was the person who brought my items out to the car. She was very professional and helpful. Even though I hate being carded, she explained in a professional manner that she card everyone. I get it, no hard feelings for associates that are polite and respectful.

reviews.title: Ten percent are rotten.
reviews.review_text: We order about 10 avocados a week, by on line, and they're delivered from the nearby store. About one in 10 avocados are disgustingly rotten inside, even though they look and feel fine on the outside. The other nine are very good and tasty. At a buck apiece, it's not worth making a fuss over...but it is disturbing to find one filled with brown or black yuck inside. They ask for photos. No. I don't want to ruin anyone's appetite!

I hate order my fruit and vegetables when I do my online order due to the pickers not paying attention to ripe same with meat I can't count how many time I get close dated meat or day of expire. I love ordering online to just pick up my order but sometime I still have to come in because I am afraid of my perishables.

I don't know who yall have to pick for puck up orders.. but what do they do ? Look for worst laying there and give to pick up orders. 3 super hard avocados. I'm done ordering fresh vegetables from Walmart. This is last straw.. last time I Order fresh tomatoes and they were molded.. good thing I looked when carry out person brought to vehicle. He carried back in an exchange tomatoes.

Something wrong with these avocados, when I finally got them to ripen they are brown inside. They have an odd flavor. They were different looking from the other avocados that I have gotten nearly every grocery order I have done. Very disappointing!! I have found info online stating that they must have been picked too early...

reviews.title: OVERRIPE/ROTTING SMALL HAAS AVOCADOS
reviews.review_text: My last 2 orders of small bags of Haas avocados were rotten. If the person selecting them would FEEL the avocados they would notice the skin is hard and indented all over where the flesh/meat is collapsing from yellow to brown rotting. We had a large tree in our backyard for 30years growing up in Miami and I'm an expert on avocados. I was thoroughly disgusted that they keep doing this. Someone should educate the shoppers how to tell the over ripe/ rotting ones and not try to pass them off to customers. I got tired of having to call and complain.

reviews.title: PO'd in Camp Verde
reviews.review_text: I'm completely discussed it with the delivery company that has rude employees and they put your delivery at the wrong spot. You disgust me. I'm so infuriated I do not want to deal with what's his name. The driver‘s name is Freddie. The guy should be fired and held accountable for his Misconduct on becoming.

Don't try Walmart delivery! If you are a senior or disabled! Walmart hates food stamp users! Insurance healthy food benefits! If you order more than 12 items it won't be delivered or they will cut out a lot of your order!! You only get what they want to give you! Your order doesn't matter!!

reviews.title: Avocados are never ripe
reviews.review_text: When I order avocados from my neighborhood walmart they arrive and are SUPER hard. I have to let them sit for at least a week before I can eat them. Not sure if shoppers are instructed to pick no ripe avocados but I always receive them when I order online. Same goes with bananas.

I AM GOING TO *STOP* BUYING FRUITS AND VEGETABLES FROM WALMART GOING FORWARD FOR HOME DELIVERY.\ The young people pulling my orders are CLUELESS in choosing GOOD FROM BAD. I ordered an avocado IN MY LAST TWO DELIVERIES AND THE FIRST ONE WAS OVERRIPE AND BLACK INSIDE...SECOND WEEK AVOCADO WAS SO HARD AND NEVER RIPENED AND WENT BAD. CELERY, LETTUCE ...BANANAS...........I COULD GO ON AND ON.....IT'S YOUR HORRIBLE EMPLOYEES WHO DON'T PAY ATTENTION........BECAUSE THEY DON'T CARE!!!!!

I was initially impressed with the prompt service for delivery and the quality of the items for feeding my family. Unfortunately the last 6 weeks or so things have not been great. Almost all orders have been missing items changed for and dented can goods. Yesterday the chicken thighs ordered were not received and that item was for our dinner that night. What has happened to change the quality control of earlier this year. I do want to say the delivery personnel has been very professional and kind although they mostly do not speak English and I have very limited Spanish skills . I will continue to order a couple more times in hopes of improvement

These are absolutely wonderful when they come from Mexico. They are nearly useless when they come from Peru or Colombia. I suspect the latter are being picked too early, so that they never ripen properly. So, when I order online, I have stopped buying avocados, because the source is not indicated.

every time I order avocados to be delivered it's either they're rotten when I receive them or they take two to three weeks to ripen and once ripened you open them up and they're black inside this is probably the third time I've had the experience with Walmart delivery. in my opinion if you need to shop for avocados you better go in person yourself rather than have somebody else pick them up and make sure you picking them up at the right place to make sure they're fresh and edible.

reviews.title: No well chosen avocados
reviews.review_text: avocados were very hard not ripe to eat and once they ripened the whole think was black on the inside. . either they were bruised on delivery or shopper does not know how to choose a well preserved fruit or vegetable. I always get green bananas, dried up limes, soggy tomatoes and hard as a rock avocados. ill shopping for my fruits and veggies from now on. Sorry i just think that the shoppers don't care how the customers get their items, since they're not the ones consuming it they dont care. I bet if they get their items in poorly conditions (fruits/vegetable), they'd be complaining and asking for refund. bur overal price is great. you get what you pay for.

reviews.title: Just ok
reviews.review_text: I bought 4 and 2 of the 4 were bad (rotten on the inside)…I'm sure this was because whoever picked them for my order didn't look or care what they were picking as usual with the shoppers…always getting the dates that is due instead of giving a few days %26 not paying attention to what the produce looks like.

reviews.title: You need to pick your own
reviews.review_text: Ordered 2. Both arrived rock hard and one had a very soft spot. When cut open, half was normal color and soft half was grossly gray. The other one softened but was watery and bad tasting. I guess you can't expect them to pick good ones for delivery.

reviews.title: These Are An AvocaDON'T
reviews.review_text: These arrived in an unbelievably unripe condition. And that's okay. I would prefer that over them being pudding in a thin leather jacket, which I have also received. the problem is that they never fully ripened. even after nine days. i tried cutting into one, and somehow, it's both rotting and still not ripe. it literally defied the laws of nature.

reviews.title: Half of purchase unusable.
reviews.review_text: I ordered two avocados. when I got home, one was already rotten and unusable. It had to be thrown out immediately. The other one was fine. The employee who filled my order evidently did not look at the avocados very carefully. I can't afford to throw food out and lose money like that.

About six of them last week and all six of them were rotten. I was very disappointed in my purchase of them. Walmart needs to check their produce out more closely. I have had some problems with other produce before such as cucumbers being really bad.

the online/delivery has shown Haas Avacados. I buy 3 but everytime I recei e Mexico or some other country is where they came from. they are as hard as a rock. I litterally pounded a nail with one. They are not Haas Avacados-they are as small as 3inces long and they have little meat as the seed is huge. Again, not Haas Avacados. Isn't

reviews.title: Inedible Avocados
reviews.review_text: Every avocado delivered to me since june 19 has been INEDIBLE. They do not ripen, they stay very hard, then start to get a soft spot. I have ordered altogether at least 6, thinking the next might be ok. Wrong. The part that is not rotten, is hard and pale yellowish green. All have come from Colombia. The Avocados I received earlier in the year were the best ever. They were from Mexico. Why did Walmart switch from those from Mexico which were perfect this year, to the Colombian avocados? I even ordered some from different Walmart stores to see if I could get a good avocado. They were all bad....horrible.... Could not eat any part of them. I would very much like to be able to get a good avocado........HOW can I get a good avocado delivered to me??????

reviews.title: I want to love my avocadoes again
reviews.review_text: I normally live Hass avocadoes, but. unfortunately, I have not had any luck buying any good avocadoes curbside or delivery from Walmart. My avocadoes from curbside and delivery never ripen properly, so I suspect that they refrigerated them at some point during these services. These should not be refrigerated before they ripen fully.

i usually have no problems with your avocados but my last 2 orders of fresh avocados were inedible. One order was of the 5-6 count of bagged avocados and last order was for 2 individual avocados. Both orders had very dark, stringy flesh. It was a waste of money.

reviews.title: Not happy
reviews.review_text: I have been having unusual quality of avocados from Walmart. Some have real small seeds and the other medium size in the same order. Both were very hard which is good. One ripened quickly the other not completely. I prepared them and the result was strange. The one that barely was ready to eat was uneatable (3/4th of it was sickly brown and the other one was 1/2 solid and the other half perfect.). I always order two avocados and the results have often disappointed. I'm going to get them else.

Got these avocados were hard as rock lay them out to try and ripen them for over four days, took one and opened it, and it was still hard in the inside, but starting to spoil very disappointed with them usually when I get avocados from Walmart, they're fantastic

walmart used to have great veggies fruits... their produce in Texas by far was superb idk if maybe it's bc I'm in GA now but every time I order avocados...unfortunately I have a health issue that causes me to be home most days aside appointments surgery or therapy; with my orders I've been disappointed by the quality of the fresh produce and meats... let the avocados be edible before selling. I've ordered meats that were days past the expired date and yet I'm paying full price and I'm paying the price of getting sick which makes my cancer symptoms even worse. my vision is not great if i can smell it the fact it's bad when my smell sense is affected makes it very bad to guests for example who say they smell it really bad. then I'm spending hours trying to scrub my fridge then have it triple bagged in a trash until tras day with animals getting into it and the joy if my landlords drive by and see my trash is now all scattered and I'm now in my robe outside doing all this for a 8day wait for 7$!? most times i never get it back or they simply don't have something to replace it but it'll be a month before you get someone's attention to give you 5$for a 25$ paint that just got left and they sell again meaning essentially are selling stolen goods. yet we do that knowing we are going to jail. they do it and act like they're doing you a favor giving you a fraction of a coupon to only use for their stores... the customer service is the epitome of an oxymoron.

The last few times I ordered these Hass brand (3-4 per bag and 5-6 per bag) they were rotten inside, black lines running through them, mushy. Then I bought 2 single ones for 97cents each and they were the same...could not eat them. They used to be perfect from the Walmart on Norman. I won't buy them again. Sorry

ok my name is Adele Houtz i having issues with your product dapt i ordered manarins oranges on jul 29 and on the 31st they are so rotten you there leaking out of the bag I'm get tried of getting getting produce from you also the cucumbers rotten please if the manager can me that would nice. i believe the produce people need to pay more about the old stuff

The last few times I placed a grocery order with Haas Avicados, the quality has been Awful. All brown on the insides. Out of the last 6, I only was able to cut off a couple of very small chunks. I have been Very Disappointed, but have had surgery %26 am trying to recover.

4 of the 5 avocados were overripe and when I cut into them they were brown from bruising the other one was so hard and didn't even look like it was ready to be harvested. I threw those 4 out and waited 2 days for the last one to be aoft enoight to eat

The avocados that I purchase were semi soft to the touch, but rock hard when cut open. The meat of the avocado was stuck to the pit. All this after sitting in a brown bag in a dark spot for 2 wks. The taste was also very bitter. Fed this to my worm farm/composting bin. Normally I don't have any issue with these, but maybe 1-2 times per yr. This batch I would not recommend, but normally yes I would.

reviews.title: Colombian avocados
reviews.review_text: These avocados from Colombia are not great. They are picked too early, half don't ever ripe, and those that do turn out slightly soft on one side and hard on the other. They are also stringy. Although the Mexican avocados may be more expensive right now they are worth the price. Maria

reviews.title: Rotten Avocados
reviews.review_text: The avocados in last order were rotten when I cut them open. This has happened again and again; more than once, at least in the last three orders. Maybe you should look for a new supplier. I really should have let you know sooner, but the last couple of times I complained about an item; the complaint was not handled well at all.

reviews.title: Vattia Sinks
reviews.review_text: The last three times I have ordered avocados from the store they rotten before they get right so I have had to throw away like I get like 6 to 8 each time so at least 24 avocados in the last couple months so I don't know what's going on, but I'd appreciate somebody to find out why because I've been having to throw away a few things that I've been ordered regularly. That's not been up to standard even like a bag of those high dollar peaches they were rotten. I had to throw the whole bag away, I couldn't eat not even worn out of it so thank you. Thethe last three times I have ordered avocados from the store they rotten before they get right so I have had to throw away like I get like 6 to 8 each time so at least 24 avocados in the last couple months so I don't know what's going on, but I'd appreciate somebody to find out why because I've been having to throw away a few things that I've been ordered regularly. That's not been up to standard even like a bag of those high dollar peaches they were rotten. I had to throw the whole bag away, I couldn't eat not even worn out of it so thank you. Vattia Sinks

It's like they wanted to ruin my guacamole. These avocados arrived, bruised, and deflated. The moment I grabbed them from the brown Walmart paper bag, my fingers pressing so gently on their delicate skin, to my surprise my fingers depressed at least half an inch into this fruit. That's when I knew. They were garbage. Alas, I had hope. I sliced them open only to find that they were horrible.

i love haas avocados but i use the delivery service so i cant pick them myself. the last Four times i have bought avocados [3 or 4 at a time], they are rotten before they are ripe. sometimes they were from peru, those were worse!! bruised or defective in growth, adds to rotten a lot quicker. if i were choosing , i wouldnt have picked them but i have no choice.

reviews.title: Usually bad
reviews.review_text: I've had mostly bad luck over the past few months. Most times they arrive hard as a rock and take several days to soften. I open it thinking it's finally ripe, and it's mostly rotten (black) inside. A few times they have arrived extremely overripe like mush inside. I used to be able to get good quality with delivery orders most of the time but not any more.

reviews.title: Walmart Sucks
reviews.review_text: Walmart has really declined in service and overall products. Wouldn't deliver my groceries nor prescriptions and didn't even have the courtesy to notify me, just left my order hanging. Even overcharged my friend for some shoes that had a listed price but the register added 3 dollars to the checkout price. Fresh Product availability has declined and looks poor.

reviews.title: great price on these!
reviews.review_text: Usually good quality avocados and great price. If shopping in person, you can pick them to your preference however, if ordering for pickup, staff shoppers need more training on how to select this item as they are often so hard, they take a week or longer to get soft or turn fibrous while ripening and lose their flavor. I'm being honest here!!

These last 2 batcges I ordered were horrible. You need to find another brand or producer because West pak knows nothing about avacados. The last 2 batches were small round and rock hard. When they started softening just a little I opened one from each batch and there were black spots on the inside. Ive never seen this before. I know they get brown with time if you dont use them but they go through stages. Ive never seen black spots on the inside. They should be nothing but green inside when barely soft and not even ready to eat. Avacados are a regular in my diet so I wont be renewing walmart for grocery delivery.

reviews.title: Spoiled Avocados
reviews.review_text: For the past month, every time I bought Avocado from Walmart superstore in Wallingford CT, the Avocado took a very long time to ripen, and upon readiness the inside of the fruit was partially spoiled, and fibrous. I have thrown away several Avocados days after purchase due to spoiled and fibrous fruit.

reviews.title: They suck
reviews.review_text: Avocados arrived rock hard. I want to make guacamole but by the time the fruit ripened i have already eaten my guac ingredients. It took over a week to be able to cut into them and they were still hard in the middle and I'm not talking about the seed.

reviews.title: Green Ceramic Hand Grenades
reviews.review_text: Shoutout to Walmart Pascagoula for once again stocking their signature line of avocados: Green Ceramic Hand Grenades™. These bad boys are forged in the fires of Mount Doom by orcs and hardened to a density that makes diamonds look like marshmallows. I ordered them for pickup and they were obviously chosen with tremendous care — by someone who thinks avocados should double as spare parts for battleships and a desire to break teeth when someone bites into a lovely taco. At this point, I'm not waiting for guacamole — I'm waiting for the Avengers to show up and use them as weapons. It's been one week. Seven full days. These avocados remain resolutely unripe, impervious, and suspiciously dense. I'm not sure whether I bought produce or received a classified shipment of depleted-uranium slugs for the USS Zumwalt's rail gun. 88 cents each rather than $1.3 million per round. Either way, they are not for spreading on toast — they are for ballistic testing. The Ukraine could win against the Russians with these all before the first one ripens. So, to the Walmart grocery picker who lovingly hand-selected these emerald artillery shells for me: I see you. I know what you did. Somewhere between the display bin and my pickup order, you thought, “This guy doesn't deserve guacamole. He deserves geological samples.” Well played. My nachos are crying, my toast is barren, and I'm now the proud owner of produce better suited for naval warfare than taco night. Bravo. 🥑💣👏

reviews.title: No Way to Choose Ripeness
reviews.review_text: Sometimes you can wait a week for your avocado to ripen, sometimes, you'd like to use them right away. Unfortunately, Walmart delivery does not let you choose your ripeness preference. It they are unripe, sometimes, I'll even stock up, but who knows with this system. Otherwise, these are always good avocados, as far as I can tell, but what do I know, I live in Upstate New York, 1000 miles from the nearest avocado tree.

I didn't know avocados could be that hard. actually struggled to cut them. kinda ruined our Mexican food dinner as we ordered ingredients for that nights dinner. and they were completely unusable. if someone orders something for express delivery, they probably need it today. whomever picked the order, could have at least tried to find a couple of usable avocados for us. It looks like another item I can't trust you to deliver to me. I hate that I paid extra for express. and got delivered.

Two days in a row, I did not receive cilantro when it came the other day I called and I was on hold for a half hour. Nobody called me back to tell me what was gonna happen. I never received it. I got topsoil and mulch and two bunches of cilantro I ordered did not come today. I ordered cilantro kielbasa two different kinds of kielbasa. I got two of the same kinds and avocados. Didn't receive them so tell me what's up

reviews.title: rotton
reviews.review_text: these were the worst avacados I have ever gotten all 5 of them were rotten inside. the seed was sodt the avacados were hard but they were all brown and rotten if I could give them a 0 I would. I can't take them back to the store because I am disabled and I order all my food online. but these were horrible I had to throw all 5 away .

I never got to eat it! It was mushy, bruised and unable to be used. I would have asked for a refund, but it was the second day after my order delivery. Avocados usually need a ripening stage. It came hard as a rock, and mushed into nothing, on the second day I had it. I take more financial hits on WalMart produce and bread.

Great value for the money, the cheapest available where I live. And that's saying alot since it's so expensive in Hawaii. These usually come picked fresh from the produce pickers at Walmart's Grocery %26 Delivery Pickup team, in the rare ocassion that it's inedible and gone bad I've just asked for a refund using the app which was issued back immediately (but may take a few days to show on your card) and I reordered a replacement with my next order. Customer service is usually excellent with returns especially replacing produce or damaged food goods, so it is important to know if you use the delivery app, to just ask for a refund and explain why. Out of 12 orders of this item, maybe 3 were over ripped or turning black and needed refund, the rest were all excellent.

reviews.title: Old fruit and vegetable
reviews.review_text: All of the fresh fruit were of low quality I don't know who fills my orders , but it serms to me that they choose and send old items or items that has been looked over and wio my items being delivered they just throw something in without checking for it's quality

reviews.title: Inedible avacados and horrid customer service
reviews.review_text: These avacados are mushy and black on the inside. Stringy. Gross. I ordered them delivered because I don't have a car at the moment. They expect me to keep rotten food in my fridge and to return them when I have no way to get them there. They really need to teach their shoppers how to shop. Very disappointed and disgusted with the quality of the food their shopper picked out for me. Seriously upset they don't deliver quality avacados to replace the horrid ones they had delivered. Its just awesome they will give me until Aug 10th to return them for a refund. I threw them away when the mold started to grow. I would take away the shoppers tip if I had that option.

reviews.title: Order review
reviews.review_text: I am giving 5 stars for this order of avocados only. These are big and fresh. Not only do they look great, the color inside is gorgeous, and they taste amazing. I would also like to thank the person who shopped my order. You did an amazing job! I regularly order avocados and up until this order, I've been debating going somewhere else. Sometimes, it looks as if Wal-mart's personal shoppers don't pay any attention to the produce they pick for customers. The last several times I've ordered avocados, they've been gross; brown and greenish inside, squishy on the outside, I've had to throw some out. A person with some sense would know that it should've been tossed out, not used for an order. I don't know who will be reading this, but if it's a consumer please be cautious when ordering. If this review goes straight to Wal-Mart, my suggestion is; you should have a competent person training your personal shoppers so no one has to put up with this. I realize you guys are great about refunding money on items that are spoiled and/or for items that your shoppers forgot to shop for and we didn't get them, but that's not the point. There is a reason a certain item was asked for, and when your shoppers can't tell the difference between fresh and rotten there's a problem. It totally screws up whatever we had planned, whether we need an item for a last minute event or just for dinner, we should be able to have confidence in the aptitude of your employees. I was thinking, maybe add a texting feature so the shopper can take a picture of the item and say "Hey, I noticed these avocados are super small, did you still want them?" Or take a pic and send it to ensure the customer is happy with the looks of a certain produce item. Also it would be nice if we could text the shopper and tell them how we like our produce or whatever the item may be. Having good communication is key. I know shoppers for other companies can do this. The only texting feature I have is with the person who is delivering my order. It's only helpful if they are lost, other than that it has nothing to do with the shopping part. I hope this helps.

Although I am very happy that I can get my groceries delivered straight to my front door the quality of the produce your shoppers chose for my list were very disappointing. The entire bag of green beans was rotten within 3 days Avocados were all over ripe. I prefer them greener so they last longer. Out of two bunches of broccoli that I ordered, one was old and flimsey while the other was fresher. The red pepper was old and wrinkled. Not fresh at all like when I choose them myself.

reviews.title: Small Avocadoes from Walmart Are Great!
reviews.review_text: Kudos to the produce department at Walmart for th[s selection of tasty avocadoes. I have food delivered, and I always get wonderful avocados. They are ready to soften by the next day or two and have very minimal bruising if any. These are much better than the ones I find in the produce section of many groceries stores I visit. I always order my avocadoes from Walmart now. The avocadoes are smaller than normal, but the pit is usually smaller, so you still get enough flesh for any recipe you have.

reviews.title: I will take pictures next time I can't use them.
reviews.review_text: I ordered 7 avocados last week. I was able to use 3. 2 were rotten and 2 were so hard after 15 days I couldn't squish them through my fingers. The week before I ordered 5 and 3 were blackened on the inside.. The one's from Mexico were better than the ones from Columbia. I don't know why?

reviews.title: Unusable Avocados
reviews.review_text: The last three times I purchased avocados from Walmart I had to throw each and every single one of them into the garbage. They were all black on the inside. I have given up ordering them from Walmart ever again. I can't show you what they looked like as as soon as I cut them I threw them out.

reviews.title: No thanks
reviews.review_text: I've been consistently disappointed in the quality of the avocados from Walmart, though I hear we can blame that on tarrifs, but who knows the truth, anymore? These always come hard, meaning I have to put them in a paper sack and set thim in a warm place for a while. The problem is they go from hard as a rock to mushy with white fungus growing on them QUICK. You check them every day, hard, hard, hard, still hard, spoiled

I do home delivery, so the Walmart shoppers always seem to pick the smallest avocado that's already half rotten! So in the garbage bin it goes… but, Walmart's always great at giving refunds back! Just wish they would train the associates how to pick out fruits and vegetables… 🤷🏻‍♀️ I am thinking their reclamations associate doesn't want to deal with rotten fruit or vegetables so in our order it goes! Safeway seems to know how to please their customers and they give the best freshest produce ever!

reviews.title: Nasty avocados
reviews.review_text: The last 4 times I purchased Haas avocados they were disgusting, the inside was grayish with hard spots, so unappealing I threw them all in the trash and will never buy Haas again. I thought they were supposed to be the superior choice for avocados. I would rather have Florida avocados, but have not seen them in Walmart's produce department.

reviews.title: Dead avacado
reviews.review_text: I'd rather not give a star. 0 for our 2 avocados because they were sheat . We threw them away on count of one half being brown some parts were very hard like it was in ripe the other was just over done being brown. There hard to buy and pick out I know. And our delivery person just didn't understand what to look for in an avacado. I guess

These avocados were delicious. Kept them out until slightly soft then ate one. Sooo good. Then waited a few days and put the uneaten 2 left in the fridge. Very good to the very last one eaten. Best avacado taste so far this year. I eat a lot of avocados too.

reviews.title: No response! Anybody home?!
reviews.review_text: One of the avocados was basically rotten when it got here the other one only had about a day before it had to be eaten. Did a return for a refund and no response. Try to use the chat and no one answered for 45 minutes! Sent emails, including to the CEO of the company no response from anybody. I think you got ” some ‘splaining to do Lucy!”

reviews.title: Buyer beware.
reviews.review_text: I would very much like to leave a review on this product, but it seems my account has been suspended, without notice, for using my IN HOME delivery and return to return items, and all my orders are automatically canceled after they are placed, my card charged, they are confirmed, and then the system automatically cancels them. Beware of using your IN HOME membership to try on clothing and return items if they don't fit or aren't the quality you'd expect. I paid for a service and can't use it. Customer support in India can't help me. I've tried multiple times to no avail. I'm disabled and rely upon this service, pay for all the upgrades, and can't even order food for pick up. My account is of no use. So, I don't know how my avocados would have tasted.

reviews.title: Avocado Review
reviews.review_text: What can I say about avocados other than they are delish and nutritious and you have about 0.2 seconds to enjoy them at their peak ripeness. If I'm getting delivery, I always expect to have them underripe but I appreciate the people picking them out and looking out for me that they aren't over ripe!

reviews.title: dont order produce items online

The flavor is completely different. The texture is different and I did not like them in the past this is not what I ordered. I would like my money back so I need to speak to someone to get my money back because I'm not gonna use these.

I really like the avocados from Walmart I let them sit on the counter for a couple of days to get a little bit soft and then add a little bit of lime juice and lemon juice and they hold really well in the refrigerator in a small container since I don't like to eat a whole bunch at one time but I make chalupas out of them with yellow corn tortillas hard and also like today I added them to my hamburger for me and my wife they were really really good that's a Hawaiian treat that most people don't know about

reviews.title: Fruit
reviews.review_text: I've ordered from Walmart for a few months now to use your delivery service. There's usually always a problem. The avocados were over ripe. I mean really mushy by the time I got them so whoever picked them pick them wrong!!! I also have a problem with your plantains. They're turning different colors not the useful black. Kinda like a green? I don't know so watch your produce that leaves please.!!

I've had these delivered, (so Walmart personnel filled the order). I don't have any complaints ~~ they've been firm (I ripened them as I needed them), fresh, good-sized. I wish prices were better, but I've compared these avocados to those of other stores and they are comparable in quality, price, and size, or better.

reviews.title: avocados
reviews.review_text: I buy avocados nearly every week because they're very healthy for you and I love them on many things. however the last couple of months that I have bought them their heart is a rock and when you put them in the window for one day to ripen they are black inside and have to be thrown in the trash

reviews.title: WALMART re-organization
reviews.review_text: 10:13:2025 I placed a food order with WALMART for the above listed date. Three different people came three separate times with the same order. I think they are using AI, I respect AI, but I don't have the patience to deal with this nonsense. I canceled my contract with WALMART. WALMART needs to get organized.

reviews.title: Unbeatable Value and Consistent Quality!
reviews.review_text: Let's talk about a game-changer in my kitchen: these Fresh Hass Avocados! I've tried avocados from all over, but I keep coming back to these for three unbeatable reasons. First, the value is absolutely incredible. I consistently find them for up to $1 OFF each compared to other grocery stores, which adds up to massive savings for an avocado lover like me. Second, the quality is remarkably consistent. I don't get the rock-hard or already-mushy frustration anymore; they ripen perfectly every single time into that dreamy, creamy green goodness. And finally, the size! These are not the puny, disappointing avocados you sometimes find. They're a great, substantial size—one is perfect for two slices of toast or a generous portion of guacamole. If you want fantastic quality, great size, and unbelievable value, you simply cannot beat these Fresh Hass Avocados. 10/10 recommend

reviews.title: Bad batch of avocados since August 2025
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately, this batch of avocados were terrible! I usually buy them green and let them ripe at home so they can be perfect when needed . I buy about 10 avocados at the beginning of the week, but every batch of avocados I bought since August 2025 has been really bad. There is no flavor and they look grey inside. I've seen people squeezing the green avocados ( IF THE AVOCADO IS GREEN, IS NOT READY, STOP SQUEEZING THEM AND RUINING THEM !!!) avocados will turn black and will be firm when ready. If it's black and soft, it's not good anymore.

reviews.title: Good enough for all walmart shoppers
reviews.review_text: Beneath a rough and bumpy skin, A world of creamy green is found within No harsh bite, no overly sweet flair, Just fair velvet texture for one to compare From toast to taco, dip to spread, healthy, the happy fuel is fed. As a buttery dream, a subtle, earthy grace, A savory fruit in each taste.

reviews.title: avocado
reviews.review_text: they were hard when i got them and several days later they were still hard. i tried to use one and it was very rubbery. had to throw it away. bought them a second time and they were the same way. waited longer and they were a bit softer but brown so had to throw them away. tried one more time and they were softer but not creamy almost gritty looking.

reviews.title: It's always hit or miss with walmart produce.
reviews.review_text: There is an overall lack of consistency with the quality and availability of walmart produce. It used to be the go to because it was always the cheapest option but it's not anymore. I can't think of any good reason to shop produce at walmart over somewhere else. It's hit-or-miss, and not a great value.

reviews.title: Almost always perfect
reviews.review_text: The price is great, especially compared to my local grocery store. The size isn't always big, but most of the time they are a good size and ripeness, that is as long as the grocery store shopper knows how to select a good avocado - which has improved since I first bag ordering my groceries delivered. Only once during the 10 months I've been subscribing for delivery, were the avocados bad. They looked good, so no blame on the shopper. But I got 3 that never did ripen. They went from rock hard to rotten. Otherwise, when I cut into the Walmart Hass avocados, they're beautifully green with only the rare bruise. The flavor and texture is great for sandwiches (instead of mayo), burgers and the big meal-sized salads I so enjoy several times a week.

reviews.title: Horrible avocados
reviews.review_text: I bought several avocados in last 2 grocery pick up orders. They were ALL, 10 in all, horribly bruised. Every avocado I cut into was all brown with a bit of green, inside. Unfortunately I'll have to go dig in the trash to take a picture. It's bad enough that groceries have become insanely expensive, but to be expected to do that just goes too far!!!!

avocados were very hard - took days outside and inside the refrigerator to near readiness though were still hard in spots and ripe in others and brown avocado flesh, this is a usual for avocados during the year, sometimes you score with them and occasionally you have to write about them to the sellers like today

I usually buy twice as many as I need, knowing at least half of them will be rotten and mostly brown on the inside. I have to order my groceries for delivery since I am disabled and it is hard to make it in to shop. I'll probably be switching to Fred Meyer delivery from now on.

reviews.title: Avocados
reviews.review_text: The avocados either have ugly bumps on them, are half soft half hard, or are completely soft. My daughter and I opened every one of them that we picked up that day (3 or 4) they all had pinkish/reddish dots on the inside of the skin and the edible part of the avocado.

the avocados i received were very firm so i checked them on day 2 and found 1 had slight give so i cut it in half. inside the meat was totally swirled with black, actually more black than green. i opened 2 more that were the same. i wound up throwing all in composter. I've been getting avocados form wm for long time. have you switched suppliers?

reviews.title: stay away from these
reviews.review_text: One of them had had a hole in it like someone stuck a thumb through it as they were all rotten and unusable. I do not live close to the store so does not convenient to me or worth the money to drive them back to get a refund. I think for Walmart deliveries they need to rethink the return process

reviews.title: When ripened, these are better quality.
reviews.review_text: I have found these for past month to be of better quality than the bagged avocados. After having the ones I always bought go bad as soon as they were ripe and throwing away the last whole bag I started just buying these. I have not had one of them spoil. They are usually very hard at first, I leave them on the counter and check them frequently for ripeness. As soon as they are not really hard, getting some softer feel, I put them in the refrigerator for longer life. You do have to really watch them to get them at a ripe stage, don't put them in the refrigerator until they are ripe, as in not hard as a rock. I have been buying the bagged ones for a long time, they do seem to ripen quicker. I had 3 orders in a row where the bagged ones were either all spoiled or the last couple I went to use were bad. I have not had a bad one yet buying these.

reviews.title: Avocado flor y we ur salad!!
reviews.review_text: It is hard to know when to pick them.It is is hard because if too green the taste is disappointing. If too ripe and you do not want guacamole it does not taste quite right. But the produce section does not disappoint. Avocados are picked for us just try right!!

Most of the produce I've ordered has been “OK” but those who select %26 pack %26 pack again into vehicle could pay closer attention to pre-bruising and damage done while handling. Please be more vigilant w/ other people's food/merchandise.

Use those when they're green and soft to the touch.

reviews.title: Great Haas
reviews.review_text: I always buy Haas avocados. They are one of the staples in my home. I use many fresh produce products and fresh is always best. I always get good quality avocados from Walmart. As long as the quality continues to be. Excellent and reasonably priced I will always buy their avocados.

reviews.title: not ripe
reviews.review_text: I always get my groceries curbside, so I don't get to pick out the produce myself. Whenever I buy avocados, they are green, so I have to leave them out on the counter until they ripen before I can use them. This time, the ripening took 2 weeks... by which time, I had already finished what I wanted it to go with. Walmart's avocados are okay, but you really have to plan ahead for when you want one! I wish they would just give you one that's close to ready to use without being too green or too ripe.

I'd regularly been buying single small avocadoes, and decided I could use up a bag before they turned brown. Initially all ripened and were good tasting with smooth textures. This past week, I discovered one was bruised badly, but I continued to store the rest in brown paper to ripen. Once softened and cut, their consistency was mealy. I tried to salvage one with seasonings and making guacamole, but the result was inedible.

reviews.title: ROTTEN FOOD
reviews.review_text: Rotten to the core. There is no possible way that the shopper/driver didn't know that these two avocado's weren't rotten!!! A person of any ethnicity would know and the shopper/driver who brought us these two avocado's only spoke Spanish...so I am assuming is Latina. We couldn't even communicate with her because she didn't speak English. That means she intentionally brought us rotten avocado's and I am being made to pay for it. I am crippled. I do not walk. I also do not have a vehicle. I am being told by Walmart customer service to return the 2 rotten avocado's to the store if I want my money back, but that is not something I can do. Maybe...if Walmart...starts requiring people that work with their customers to speak English AND makes them pay for the inedible food they pick out, I will stop losing SO MUCH MONEY.

Perhaps Walmart needs to better train its delivery shoppers on how to choose the best produce rather than grab the first item in the department. Its unacceptable to sell and deliver rotten food.

reviews.title: Meh.
reviews.review_text: If you want avacados you have to buy these but the quality is all over the map. Sometimes the pits are huge, sometimes they are rotted in places on the inside. I'd say about 80% of the time they are ok, it's just those anomolies that make me annoyed.

My order of avocado was okay in the size and look department. I was disappointed with one. when I cut it opened, it was rotten. So, that was garbage! I did enjoy the one, I did get to eat. It had great flavor and the color of the flesh was a pretty, bright green!

reviews.title: not so much
reviews.review_text: All the avocados were discolored had blemishes and hard pieces in the flesh I don't know what that is cuz I've never had a avocado like it. I'm not sure if it's a regional situation or if there's something else going on but they were very low quality

I'm saying that I recommend this product, but beware, all of the avocados are at the same stage at all times. None of them will be ripe when you get them, and then all of them will instantly be the same level of ripe and you will never, unless you are making a batch of guacamole or are an avocado fiend or are feeding a family and needs several of them, Use them all up before they go bad. Just a heads up. Outside of that, these are nice avocados and I buy them with some regularity.

reviews.title: INFERIOR HAAS AVOCADOS FROM COLOMBIA
reviews.review_text: I am a vegan and 40-45% of my food consumption is Haas Avocados. It seems that the Haas avocados that you now stock are from Colombia; whereas previously your Haas avocados were from Mexico. These Colombian Haas Avocados ripen (start turning brown) almost immediately, while the avocado is still very hard. This holds true for both the bagged and individuals. If Walmart continues to buy its Haas Avocados from Colombia, I will go elsewhere for my Haas Avocados.

reviews.title: Hard avocados
reviews.review_text: Every avocado I receive is always as hard as a rock. I would like to be able to use one at least within a day or two of purchase. They end up sitting on my counter for a long time. I've quit ordering and will have stop at a grocery store now to select my own.

reviews.title: great flavor
reviews.review_text: Fresh Hass Avocados: A Kitchen Essential As a culinary enthusiast, I can confidently say that fresh Hass avocados are an absolute kitchen essential. Their rich, creamy texture and distinct, nutty flavor elevate countless dishes, from simple toasts to elaborate salads. I've found the quality of fresh Hass avocados to be consistently reliable. When perfectly ripe, they yield gently to pressure, offering that ideal buttery consistency without being stringy or bruised inside. They're incredibly versatile; whether I'm mashing them for a vibrant guacamole, slicing them to top a spicy taco, or dicing them for a refreshing salsa, they always add a layer of luxuriousness. Beyond their delicious taste, these avocados are also a fantastic source of healthy fats and nutrients, making them a guilt-free indulgence. For anyone looking to add flavor, texture, and nutritional value to their meals, fresh Hass avocados are an unbeatable choice.

Your avocados are so strange Walmart. I don't recommend buying avocados from the Walmart I go to at least, because they're still hard when ripe with weirdd brown veiny things in them. They have to practically be spoiled if they ever do soften up enough to eat. I've bought them and bought them and bought them and they just aren't like normal avocados where they're edible when they should be. Once in awhile I'm able to eat some of 1/2 of one of these which is nice, but usually they are just off. I stopped buying them. If I have to pay more even, I'll just get them elsewhere.

These are the worst no flavor and they are not Hass , I selected Hass Avocado, these were horrible! These were all thrown in the garbage! After attempting to make guacamole with them, black lines on the inner flesh meat of the avocado. And absolutely no flavor. Too small as well. The outer skin is brown and bumpy, these are horrible . If I can't get Hass Avocado on my order I'll stop going to Walmart!

reviews.title: delicious and so healthy
reviews.review_text: Avocados are so healthy! I try to have a little every day. These are as good as any I've bought. They make great guac, and I'm seeing recipes all over social media for avocado pudding and ice cream. I don't know about all that, but a few chunks are good with most meals I prepare.

reviews.title: Disappointed purchase
reviews.review_text: I've never bought avocados before so I thought I'd try them but I will definitely never buy them again! Three out of the four got really hard and dried up and the fourth one is just now getting soft. I read up on them from a Martha Stewart page and it said when they're hard, they're not good so I ended up throwing them away. What a waste of money.

reviews.title: Ripening an avocado can be a problem.
reviews.review_text: They are extremely hard, must let it sit for almost a week to soften to use, you can put a avocado in a small brown bag with about 1/2 cup of flour, it normally softens much faster, I've noticed w these they haven't been “ripening properly”, they ended up almost collapsing in a sense, they shld have ripened fine. I appreciate they're having problems in the fields due to lack of workers…this is just the beginning too.

reviews.title: Avocado-Extremely Horrible Quality
reviews.review_text: I have gotten avocados from your store on countless occasions! These were the worst I've ever seen! They were beautifully green and firm; however, upon cutting them open they were completely black! It was like they rotted from the inside out! It wasn't just one or two of them, it was every single one of them! Needless to say, they were all thrown in the garbage! Very disappointing!

reviews.title: Avocados...
reviews.review_text: I don't really care for them but I can hide them very easily in a smoothie and get the benefits of them. The picker for my delivery did a great job in getting me a very healthy dark avocado, but I was surprised the avocado was not as ripe as it indicated. Disappointing because it causes the flavor to be off. Sad part is you either get way under ripe produce or rotten produce...recent watermelon was the same way - nice green, nice thump...but cutting into it 3 days later, it was so pale and actually tasted unripe. Bananas, if you get a bunch, sure you can help ripen some of them, but others are more stubborn. Then, when they do come of age, you have to do something with the entire lot, or else they will go bad before you get them all eaten. Sheesh...lol

I buy avocados from Walmart weekly- usually 5 or more. But they recently have changed suppliers because they used to always be good, and came from Mexico. Now you can't find a single ripe one and then when they do ripen days later at home, they are completely rancid and inedible. You're lucky to get a small green patch to eat out of each one but usually can't find a good spot. I have thrown so many avocados away I finally stopped buying them from Walmart. It's disappointing as not many places to get groceries in Pierre. Hoping they will reconsider suppliers.

They must have been picked too early. They are rotting before they get ripe. They are turning black while the center area is still hard and yellow. (Get the organics in the black mesh bags. They ripen properly and taste great.) These are horrible. I will not accept them as a substitute again.

reviews.title: Patience
reviews.review_text: I used to spend time going through all the avocados, finding the perfect ripeness and now I just learned patience. I get a beautiful avocado and just wait for it to be ripe at my house.. I'm sure that's not a secret tons of people do it, but it really changed how I buy avocados personally
